text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kubo was born in Osaka Prefecture on December 28, 1966. When she was junior high school student, she played for Takatsuki Ladies FC. The club won the 2nd place in 1979 Empress's Cup. When she was high school student, she played for Nishiyama High School Club. After graduating from high school, she returned to Takatsuki Ladies FC. When she was 23 years old, she got married and retired from playing career. On September 6, 1981, when Kubo was 14 years and 262 days, she debuted for the Japan national team against England. It made her the youngest player who represented Japan. She played 4 games for Japan until 1984. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1981 1 0 1982 0 0 1983 0 0 1984 3 0 Total 4 0 ==References== Category:1966 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Osaka Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers
title: Emiko Kubo
